27df91be-2b46-4839-9c8a-55a30c17e163.description: The Senior Claim Law Associate (SCLA) is American Educational Institute's highest professional designation for educational achievement -- the ultimate in claims law professionalism. This designation consists of a rigorous course of study, requiring candidates to complete four programs in diverse areas of claims law. This challenging program ensures that SCLA designees possess a broad-based knowledge of claims law and the ability to handle all types of insurance claims effectively.

alignments.name: National College Credit Recommendation Service (National CCRS) Member
alignments.description: American Educational Institute is a member of the National College Credit Recommendation Service (National CCRS). The National CCRS has evaluated AEI’s courses and issued recommendations for college credit equivalencies for those courses. Courses are also recognized for continuing education credit toward adjuster license renewal in many states.

badge_template_activities.title: The designee has successfully earned the Senior Claim Law Associate (SCLA) designation, completing the Legal Principles, plus three other of American Educational Institute's programs.
Candidates must first complete the self-study Legal Principles program, which provides a solid foundation in areas of law including Contracts, Torts, Damages, and Subrogation.
Each AEI program consists of seven separate courses covering various claims-law subjects and requires the successful completion of a comprehensive examination for each course within the program.
After completing the self-study Legal Principles program, candidates must complete three of AEI's five other programs: Liability, Property, Workers' Compensation, Fraud and Automobile.
